qas.question: What is the name of the major daily editorial newspaper for the city of New Haven?
What is the civic news forum that specifically reports on downtown New Haven?
What weekly entertainment print news source for New Haven is backed by The Register?
Channel 65 is New Haven's home to what PBS affiliate?
What weekly publication in New Haven is issued by Yale University?
What is the main newspaper company for New Haven?
The other newspaper, New Haven Advocate is run by which company?
There is newspaper company within the city that runs monthly, it's name ?
What is the name of the tabloid that is run by mainly college students?
In terms of news and sports does New Haven receive television broadcasting from other cities?

answers.text: All New York City news and sports

context: New Haven is served by the daily <a0_0><a5_0>New Haven Register<a5_0/><a0_0/>, the weekly "alternative" New Haven Advocate (which is run by <a6_0>Tribune<a6_0/>, the corporation owning the Hartford Courant), the online daily New Haven Independent, and the monthly <a7_0>Grand News Community Newspaper<a7_0/>. Downtown New Haven is covered by an in-depth civic news forum, <a1_0>Design New Haven<a1_0/>. The Register also backs <a2_0>PLAY magazine<a2_0/>, a weekly entertainment publication. The city is also served by several student-run papers, including the Yale Daily News, the weekly <a4_0>Yale Herald<a4_0/> and a humor tabloid, <a8_0>Rumpus Magazine<a8_0/>. WTNH Channel 8, the ABC affiliate for Connecticut, WCTX Channel 59, the MyNetworkTV affiliate for the state, and <a3_0>Connecticut Public Television<a3_0/> station WEDY channel 65, a PBS affiliate, broadcast from New Haven. <a9_0>All New York City news and sports<a9_0/> team stations broadcast to New Haven County.
